onSetProtocol(android.bluetooth.Bluetoot.Description: Callback called when SET_PROTOCOL is received from remote host. Application shall use this information to send only reports valid for given protocol mode. By default, @B_android#bluetooth#BluetoothHidDevice#PROTOCOL_REPORT_MODE_E@ shall be assumed.
onSetProtocol(android.bluetooth.Bluetoot.FullName: public void onSetProtocol (BluetoothDevice device, byte protocol)

Parameters: BluetoothDevice: @B_android#bluetooth#BluetoothDevice_E@ object which represents host that currently has Virtual Cable established with device. Only valid when application is registered, can be null.
boolean: true if application is registered, false otherwise.
onAppStatusChanged(android.bluetooth.Blu.Description: Callback called when application registration state changes. Usually it's called due to either @B_android#bluetooth#BluetoothHidDevice#registerApp_E@ or @B_android#bluetooth#BluetoothHidDevice#unregisterApp_E@ , but can be also unsolicited in case e.g. Bluetooth was turned off in which case application is unregistered automatically.
onAppStatusChanged(android.bluetooth.Blu.FullName: public void onAppStatusChanged (BluetoothDevice pluggedDevice, boolean registered)

Parameters: BluetoothDevice: @B_android#bluetooth#BluetoothDevice_E@ object representing host device which connection state was changed.
int: Connection state as defined in @B_android#bluetooth#BluetoothProfile_E@.
onConnectionStateChanged(android.bluetoo.Description: Callback called when connection state with remote host was changed. Application can assume than Virtual Cable is established when called with @B_android#bluetooth#BluetoothProfile#STATE_CONNECTED_E@ state.
onConnectionStateChanged(android.bluetoo.FullName: public void onConnectionStateChanged (BluetoothDevice device, int state)

Parameters: byte: Requested Report Id, can be 0 if no Report Id are defined in descriptor.
int: Requested buffer size, application shall respond with at least given number of bytes.
onGetReport(android.bluetooth.BluetoothD.Description: Callback called when GET_REPORT is received from remote host. Should be replied by application using @B_android#bluetooth#BluetoothHidDevice#replyReport_E@.
onGetReport(android.bluetooth.BluetoothD.FullName: public void onGetReport (BluetoothDevice device, byte type, byte id, int bufferSize)

onInterruptData(android.bluetooth.Blueto.Description: Callback called when report data is received over interrupt channel. Report Type is assumed to be @B_android#bluetooth#BluetoothHidDevice#REPORT_TYPE_OUTPUT_E@.
onInterruptData(android.bluetooth.Blueto.FullName: public void onInterruptData (BluetoothDevice device, byte reportId, byte[] data)

onSetReport(android.bluetooth.BluetoothD.Description: Callback called when SET_REPORT is received from remote host. In case received data are invalid, application shall respond with @B_android#bluetooth#BluetoothHidDevice#reportError_E@.
onSetReport(android.bluetooth.BluetoothD.FullName: public void onSetReport (BluetoothDevice device, byte type, byte id, byte[] data)

onVirtualCableUnplug(android.bluetooth.B.Description: Callback called when Virtual Cable is removed. After this callback is received connection will be disconnected automatically.

ClassDesc: The template class that applications use to call callback functions on events from the HID host. Callback functions are wrapped in this class and registered to the Android system during app registration.
